Styles

This section covers basic HTML tags, such as headings, buttons, form controls or lists. Think of these as the building blocks that can either be used on their own or to create components or layouts.

Groups of tags are included in cases where a single element should not exist on its own. For example, an <input> tag should usually be accompanied by a <label>, so those two are demonstrated as a single pattern.

Alerts

Alerts

Alerts are super handy

Something will happen soon, just FYI.
Great job! You won the thing!
Before you continue, you should know this thing.

Use .alert-bottom to flip the fade-out styling.

Colors

Color Palette

Buttons

Button Overview

Button styles can be applied to a variety of elements, as shown below. In general, it is preferred to use the <a> tag when linking to another document or a section of the current document. Buttons that perform any other action should use the <button> tag.

Note that only the <a> and <button> tags include the pulse animation. Don't ask why.

Anchor tag

Button Colors

Button States

Disabled styles are available button and input tags by applying the disabled attribute. Anchor tags can appear disabled by adding the .disabled class, though this does not actually disable the link.

Secondary

Button Sizes

A compact size is available when buttons need to fit in small spaces. Buttons with long labels automatically get smaller padding.

When used with the Modernizr touchevents test, touch-enabled devices will get larger buttons.

Full-width buttons

When you need a button to fill the available space in a grid layout, simply add the btn-block modifier class.

Forms

Basic form

Forms are used to gather input from the user.

Checkbox

See some checkboxes in action!

Radio button

See some radio buttons in action!

Select

The select control allows users to select a single option from a list to be added to the form submission.

Textarea

Forms are used to gather input from the user.

Toggle

The toggle control is an alternate way of displaying a radio button to allow users to toggle between two or more values in a form. This is a different application than a tab, which looks similar, but is used to toggle content panes.

Validation states

Contextual error messages are displayed to the user below the input field.

Note that there are two markup options available. The first is for when you can apply the validation class name to the parent .form-group. The second is for when you need to apply the validation class name directly to the .form-control and .form-msg elements.

Looks good!

Please enter a valid email address

Please enter a valid email address

Please enter a valid email address

Grid

Grid overview

Grids are made up of containers, rows, and columns. Each page should have one or more containers, but a container should never need to be nested within another container. Rows

col-xs-6
col-xs-6
col-xs-4
col-xs-4
col-xs-4
col-xs-3
col-xs-3
col-xs-3
col-xs-3
col-xs-3
col-xs-9

Responsive columns

The grid enables responsive layouts by allowing you to specify how many columns each element takes up at each breakpoint. Resize your browser window to see the columns below change their relative width at each breakpoint.

12 columns on XS6 columns on SM4 columns on MD8 columns on LG6 columns on XL

Column offsets

Sometimes you need to put space between columns. The grid comes with column offset classes for just this reason, so don't be a chump and add empty columns to your layout.

6 Columns, offset by 3
4 Columns, offset by 4
6 Columns, offset by 6
4 Columns, offset by 8

Push/pull

Use push/pull to swap order of columns or just move things around. Push classes move things to the right, while pull moves them to the left.

I'm first in document order
Surprise! I'm second

Tables

Table overview

Here's how tables look in Apollo. A few different button styles have been used to show how each looks in a table.

Country Capital Population Language
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English
Germany Berlin 81 million German
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish
Source: Wikipedia

Compact spacing

If you need tighter spacing on your tables, simply add .table-sm to the <table> and the cell padding is reduced throughout.

Country Capital Population Language
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English
Germany Berlin 81 million German
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish

Hover rows

If you have your table wired to take some action when a user clicks on a row, adding the .table-hover class gives a nice visual indication to the user that the row is clickable. Add the .table-active class to a row to show that it has been selected.

Country Capital Population Language
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English
Germany Berlin 81 million German
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish

Highlight rows

Highlight rows with status indicators by adding a class like .table-success to a row to get a border and light background color. If you want a more subtle indicator, use .table-success-border to get just the side border.

Country Capital Population Language
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English
Germany Berlin 81 million German
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish
Czech Republic Prague 10.5 million Czech
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English
Germany Berlin 81 million German
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish
Czech Republic Prague 10.5 million Czech
